meanings.sent1: His swellheadedness made it hard for others to work with him.
meanings.sent2: Her swellheadedness often led to conflicts with her colleagues.
meanings.sent3: Despite his swellheadedness, he couldn't even solve a simple math problem.
meanings.sent4: The swellheadedness of the lion made all the other animals fear him.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's swellheadedness made the students feel uncomfortable in class.

meanings.definition: The state of being conceited or full of oneself
meanings.sent1: She displayed her swellheadedness by constantly talking about her achievements.
meanings.sent2: His swellheadedness made it difficult for him to accept feedback.
meanings.sent3: Even the mirror couldn't handle her swellheadedness as it cracked from vanity.
meanings.sent4: The swellheadedness of the peacock was evident in its extravagant display of feathers.
meanings.sent5: The swellheadedness of the politician turned voters away from supporting him.
